column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.FoR|FrameType
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Groundobject|
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Target|
#Text=A community group has been set up to fight against plans to build a windfarm on the north-east edge of Rannoch Moor .
#Text=The group , who have named themselves Keep Rannoch Wild , are opposing the proposed Talladh-a-Bheithe windfarm which would be built near Loch Ericht .
#Text=Group spokesman Douglas Wynn of Rannoch has warned that the development would be destructive to the surrounding area , which inlcudes Rannoch Moor and munro Ben Alder .
#Text=Around 200 people have already backed the campaign .
#Text=The windfarm would include turbines standing at 410ft tall , on the estate of the same name .
#Text=The plan has been put forward by Dutch company Eventus .
#Text=Mr Wynn said : A windfarm would be totally destructive for the landscape around Rannoch Moor and further afield .
#Text=We believe that it will be possible to see the turbines from the Glencoe road and the West Highland Way , as well as the Ben Alder hills which are much closer .
#Text=The impact will be immense visually and on wildlife in the area .
#Text=This is a part of the country which has so far remained as a wild land and we hope to keep it that way .
#Text=The campaigners have been backed by outdoor charities the John Muir Trust and the Mountaineering Council of Scotland ( MCoS ) who both objected to the proposals .
#Text=The site about 15 miles south of Dalwhinnie in a remote region between Loch Ericht and Loch Rannoch .
#Text=David Gibson , MCoS chief officer , said : This proposal would affect an area which has a unique landscape character offering panoramic views over a fantastic area of wild land .
#Text=It is a stunning landscape vista which is very sensitive to any form of intrusive human activity and an increasingly rare and valuable experience in Scotland .

#Text=Any presumed benefit from this development would be far outweighed by the damage it would do to such a distinctive landscape which is vital not only to highland Perthshire 's identity but also to Scotland 's international image .
#Text=A spokesman for developer Talladh-a-Bheithe Wind Farm Limited said : Having worked closely with the local community , we are greatly encouraged by the response we have received to date .
#Text=Our plans would make a valuable contribution towards Scottish and UK government targets for energy from renewable sources .
#Text=We are very eager to continue to explore a range of community benefits , including a commitment to making an annual contribution to a community trust fund .
#Text=
